poem:
Refuge: Maungdaw

Against the river, where
sorrow cannot swim—
children rain into
muddy waters,
eyes wide open to
an unfathomable sky,
drones' hum and feathers
blackened. Their 
silence louder, pooling 
in graves of silt— 
unmarked 
moments lost 
beneath history's wave.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Children among up to 200 Rohingya killed in Myanmar drone attack Many dozens of Rohingya people, including children, were killed in an artillery and drone attack that targeted civilians as they tried to flee Myanmar last week. Civilians were trying to escape violence in Maungdaw town, Rakhine state, by crossing the Naf River into Bangladesh when they were targeted last Monday. Videos shared on social media, which appeared to have been taken in the aftermath". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
